poem:
Quotas and Clashes

Students march in Dhaka's haze,
seeking futures past the blaze—
a court's decree, a protest's roar,
echo through the crowded moor.
Quotas marked by blood and strife,
haunt the paths of better life.
In the books of hope, they write,
against the dying of the light.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
